Package io.github.ai4ci.flow

Class ExecutionBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.flow.ExecutionBuilder
public class ExecutionBuilder extends Object
Builder that orchestrates setup, baselining and initialisation of an Outbreak instance for an experiment.

The ExecutionBuilder performs the three main phases required to turn configuration objects into a runnable outbreak: setup, model baselining and runtime initialisation. It delegates stage behaviour to a model builder which implements AbstractModelBuilder.

Important note: at present the implementation is hardwired to use DefaultModelBuilder (see the constructor). The intended design is for ExecutionBuilder to support compositional substitution of alternative builders (for example subclasses of DefaultModelBuilder that mix different default interfaces). The file includes clear TODO comments showing the places to change to support factory injection, ServiceLoader discovery or selection from SetupConfiguration.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • buildExperiment

      public static Outbreak buildExperiment(SetupConfiguration setupConfig, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig, String urnBase)
      Build an outbreak for an experiment from the supplied setup and execution configurations and an optional URN base string.
      Parameters:
      setupConfig - the setup configuration defining the population and network structure
      execConfig - the execution configuration defining runtime priors and parameters
      urnBase - an optional string to prefix the outbreak URN with (for example to distinguish different experiments or scenarios); if null the URN will be based on the setup and execution configuration alone
      Returns:
      a fully built and initialised outbreak ready for simulation

    • freeMem

      public static double freeMem()
      Utility method to check free memory in GB. This can be used to estimate the size of the outbreak that can be built without running out of memory. Note that this is a very rough estimate and actual memory usage will depend on many factors including the JVM's memory management and the specific data structures used in the outbreak model.
      Returns:
      the estimated free memory in gigabytes

    • build

      public Outbreak build()
      Return the built outbreak. This method should be called after setup, baselining and initialisation have been completed. It checks that the outbreak is fully initialised before returning it; if the outbreak is not initialised a RuntimeException is thrown to indicate that the build process has not been completed successfully. After returning the outbreak, the internal reference is set to null to prevent further modifications and to allow for garbage collection.
      Returns:
      the fully built and initialised outbreak ready for simulation

    • copy

      public ExecutionBuilder copy(long estSize)
      Create a copy of this builder with the same setup configuration and a copy of the outbreak. The outbreak copy can be a shallow or deep copy depending on the estimated size of the outbreak; if estSize is negative a deep copy is performed, otherwise a shallow copy is used to save time and memory. This is used by the parallel execution framework to create separate builder instances for each parallel thread while sharing the same setup configuration. The outbreak copy allows each thread to work with its own outbreak instance without interference, while the setup configuration can be shared since it is immutable. Cloner is used to perform the copying; it should be noted that the efficiency of the copy operation will depend on the size of the outbreak and the type of copy performed. For large outbreaks, a shallow copy may be more efficient, while for smaller outbreaks a deep copy may be acceptable.
      Parameters:
      estSize - an estimate of the outbreak size used to determine the type of copy; if negative a deep copy is performed, otherwise a shallow copy is used
      Returns:
      a new ExecutionBuilder instance with the same setup configuration and a copy of the outbreak
